description:
“6 Months Later…We haven’t changed at all… or it seems….” Half a year after the turmoil that rocked the entire city of Ikebukuro— Peace has once again returned to the city and people are living each day normally. The high school students enjoy their days of youth as the strongest and most dangerous man of Ikebukuro works diligently. The informant plots a new scheme and the headless rider is pursued by the cops as she rides through the night…But soon this normal will be cut short by the abnormal. Slowly but surely, the unknown will seize the city and face an all new storm.

(Source: Aniplex)

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Dullahan
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a Dullahan, a creature from Irish Folklore with a head that can be detached from its main body.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

サーミャ・ブレジネフ

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/t0mori)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.
[Website](https://yoshimorimakoto.com/)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryohgo_narita)__

_Ryougo Narita_ is a Japanese light novelist and manga writer. He won the Gold Prize in the 9th Dengeki Novel Prize for Baccano!, which was made into an anime television series in 2007. His series Durarara!! was also made into two anime television series, one airing in January 2010 and the second in January 2015.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ynaritaka)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).
An art director and the representative director of Studio Ara.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t0mori)
[Blog](https://www2p.biglobe.ne.jp/~s-hf/works.htm)
Freelance. Close friends with [Takahiro Kishida](https://anilist.co/staff/101403/).

__[Artist Profile (takumi-project)](http://www.takumi-project.com/artisan/tomohiro-okubo.html)__

__Birthplace:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Favorite Artist:__ The Beatles

__Tomohiro Ookubo__ is a Japaense musician, composer, arranger and lyricist.
__Birthplace:__ Nerima-ku, Tokyo, Japan __Stage Name:__ Kouki Okamoto __Kouki Hayashi__, better known by stage name Kouki Okamoto, is a Japanese guitarist, composer and member of the band OKAMOTO'S.

__Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube | Facebook__ Biography Okamoto's is a Japanese rock band, formed in 2006. They made their major label debut May 26, 2010 and were signed by record label Ariola Japan. Okamoto's was formed by four junior high school students. Fans of influential Japanese avant-garde artist Tarou Okamoto, the members took a cue from The Ramones and each adopted stage names with the surname Okamoto. Members __[Shou Okamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148602) (オカモトショウ)__ – vocals Real name Shou Iimura (飯村翔). Born October 19, 1990 in New York City. Former member of Zutto Zuletellz (ズットズレテルズ/Zuttozureteruzu) and the children's performance group Precoci. Son of American jazz saxophonist Scott Hamilton. __[Kouki Okamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148604) (オカモトコウキ)__ – guitar Real name Kouki Hayashi (林幸希i). Born November 5, 1990 in Nerima City, Tokyo, Japan. Reiji Okamoto (オカモトレイジ) – drums Real name Reiji Miyake (三宅零治). Born January 9, 1991 in Futako-Tamagawa, Setagaya, Tokyo. Former Zutto Zuletellz member. He is the eldest son of The Privates lead singer Tatsuji Nobuhara (延原達治). In his childhood he made child role dramas. Hama Okamoto (ハマ・オカモト) – bass Real name Ikumi Hamada (濵田郁未). Born March 12, 1991 in Tokyo. Former Zutto Zuletellz member. He is the eldest son of Masatoshi Hamada and Natsumi Ogawa. Former Members Masaru Okamoto (オカモトマサル) – bass (2006–2009) (Source: Wikipedia)

__Birthplace:__ New York City, New York, USA __Shou Iimura__, better known by stage name Shou Okamoto, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and former member of Zutto Zuletellz and the children's performance group Precoci. Currently a vocalist in the band OKAMOTO'S

Website | Twitter | YouTube Biography THREE LIGHTS DOWN KINGS are a four-piece rock band, more commonly known as "サンエル". They are currently under the record label santoeru Records (2016-), while having previously been under Sony Music Associated Records (2013-2016), and DISCO of LIGHTS RECORDS (2007-2013). The band formed in 2007, made their major debut in 2013 with the album "LiVERTY, and they released a second album called "ENERGIZER" in 2015. All the original members are from the Aichi Prefecture, and their live performances usually feature combinations of: electro, EDM, screamo and pop punk. This is primarily because their end goal is to be loud, while also standing out, which they want accomplish by going beyond the standard expectations of a loud band. Members - Uya (ユーヤ) - vocalist, guitar, programming (2007-) - JUNE M (ジューンエム) - bass (2007-) - NORI (ノリ) - drums (2007-) - Hiromu (ヒロム) - vocals (2016-) Former Members - GlieImo Koichi (グリエルモコーイチ) - vocals (2007-2016) (Source: ja.wikipedia.org)

**Birthplace:** Towada, Aomori Prefecture, Japan

__Biography:__
Junji Ishiwatari is a guitarist, lyricist and music producer. He was the guitarist of the rock band SUPERCAR, until they broke up in 2005. 

Ishiwatari has worked wtih [Chatmonchy](https://anilist.co/staff/105025), [9mm Parabellum Bullet](https://anilist.co/staff/126805), [Negoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148616), [NICO Touches the Walls](https://anilist.co/staff/103965), etc.
__GlieImo Koichi__ was a vocalist for the band Three Lights Down Kings (2007-2016)
